data.meanings: to rise and spread in the air (dust), be stirred (quarrel), be kindled (war), rush on, assault anyone, till (the ground). athaara - to plough, break up (the earth). atharana - raising up (clouds of dust).
data.sentence: The word فَأَثَرْنَ comes from the root ث و ر and is associated with the meanings: to rise and spread in the air (dust), be stirred (quarrel), be kindled (war), rush on, assault anyone, till (the ground). athaara - to plough, break up (the earth). atharana - raising up (clouds of dust).

data.meanings: to soak, macerate, raise, shout, increase.
data.sentence: The word نَقْعًا comes from the root ن ق ع and is associated with the meanings: to soak, macerate, raise, shout, increase.
